title: Turkmenistan Balance of Trade
description: Turkmenistan recorded a trade surplus of 5197.08 USD Million in 2021. Balance of Trade in Turkmenistan averaged 1938.87 USD Million from 1992 until 2021, reaching an all time high of 7551.27 USD Million in 2019 and a record low of -2945.38 USD Million in 2009. Turkmenistan is a major exporter of natural gas and oil. Yet, commodities price fluctuations and issues with infrastructure very often led to trade deficits. Turkmenistanâ€™s other exports include cotton, polymers, cotton, textiles and vegetable products. Turkmenistan mainly imports iron and steel pipes, heavy construction equipment, wheat, grading machinery and vehicles. Turkmenistan's main trading partners are China, Turkey, Russia, the United Arab Emirates, Germany, the Ukraine, Italy and Iran. This page provides - Turkmenistan Balance of Trade - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: SESRIC - The Statistical, Economic & Social Res. & Training Centre for Islamic Countries
